METS_Profile.title: The Matterhorn METS-Profile for Archives
METS_Profile.abstract: This METS profile describes the structure of the METS document, which is the core of the digital object model used by the Docuteam software tools to support digital archiving. The profile has been developed in cooperation by Docuteam (http://www.docuteam.ch) and the Archives de l'Etat du Valais (http://www.vs.ch/aev)

external_schema.name: Docuteam Submission Agreement (SA)
external_schema.context: The submision agreement specifies the relations between the producer and the archive as it is described in ISO 20652:2006 (Producer-archive interface -- Methodology abstract standard). The unique ID of the submission agreement and the unique ID of the submission agreement's Data Submission Session (DSS) should be placed into the "METS:mets[@TYPE]" attribute. Although this is optional, it is strongly recommended.

external_schema.name: Simple Dublin Core (DC)
external_schema.context: Descriptive metadata may be supplied in Dublin-Core format inside of a "METS:mets/METS:dmdSec/METS:mdWrap[@MDTYPE='DC']/METS:xmlData" element.

external_schema.name: Encoded Archival Description (EAD)
external_schema.context: Descriptive metadata may be supplied in EAD format inside of a "METS:mets/METS:dmdSec/METS:mdWrap[@MDTYPE='EAD']/METS:xmlData" element.

external_schema.name: Preservation Metadata: Implementation Strategies (PREMIS) 2.2
external_schema.context: Used for encoding technical and administrative metadata inside of a "METS:mets/METS:amdSec/METS:digiprovMD/METS:mdWrap[@MDTYPE='PREMIS']/METS:xmlData" element.

description.head: Label
description.p: The attribute "LABEL" is optional and contains the title of the submission agreement and the title of the respective data submission session.

description.head: Profile
description.p: The attribute "PROFILE" is mandatory and contains the static URL of the SIP-Profile, as for instance "http://www.docuteam.ch/xmlns/sip-profile.xml"

description.head: Type
description.p: The attribute "TYPE" contains the IDs of the submission agreement and the respective data submission session, separated by an underscore character ("_"). Although this item is optional, its presence is strongly recommended.

description.head: ObjID
description.p: The attribute "OBJID" is optional and contains the persistent identifier of the Information Package as soon as this has been assigned.

description.head: Creation
description.p: The attribute "CREATEDATE" is mandatory and contains the timestamp of this SIP's creation.

description.head: Modification
description.p: The attribute "LASTMODDATE" is optional. It contains the timestamp of this SIP's last modification.

description.head: Record Status
description.p: The attribute "RECORDSTATUS" is mandatory. It describes the record status in regard to the ingest process and contains a static text like "Submitted", "Validated", "Archived", "New", "Migrated", or "Confirmed". It may contain other texts as needed by the context.

description.head: Agent
description.p: At least one "METS:agent" element with the attributes "ROLE='CREATOR'" and "TYPE='INDIVIDUAL'" is mandatory. It must contain the element "METS:name" with the name of the creator. It may contain the element "METS:note" with additional notes about the creator.

description.head: General
description.p: DMD sections are optional. If one is present for an archived object, it has to contain the attribute "ID" that matches the corresponding object's "METS:div[@DMDID]" attribute in the structMap. There may be no more than one DMD section per archived object.

description.head: EAD
description.p: If the DMD section contains exactly one "METS:mdWrap[@MDTYPE = 'EAD']" element, it has to contain one valid EAD element within a "/METS:xmlData" element. The mandatory "EAD:archdesc" element must contain one "EAD:dsc/EAD:c" element with the attributes "level" and "otherlevel". The attribute "level" must contain the value "otherlevel". The attribute "otherlevel" must contain the respective object's level of description.

description.head: DC
description.p: If the DMD section contains exactly one "METS:mdWrap[@MDTYPE = 'DC']" element, it may contain one or more DC elements within a "METS:xmlData/OAI_DC:dc" element.

description.head: Other
description.p: For any other DMD section type, there exist no restrictions.

description.head: General
description.p: The METS file may contain zero or one AMD sections. The AMD section contains, if it is present, zero or more "METS:digiprovMD" elements.

A single "METS:digiprovMD" element must contain exactly one "METS:mdWrap[@MDTYPE='PREMIS']/METS:xmlData/PREMIS:premis[@version='2.2']" element, which in turn contains a possibly empty list of "PREMIS:object" elements. All "PREMIS:object" elements have to occur in the list before any "PREMIS:event" elements.
The "METS:digiprovMD" element requires the "@ID" attribute to match the corresponding object's "METS:div[@ADMID]" attribute in the structMap.

description.head: Objects
description.p: The mandatory elements within a "PREMIS:object" element are:

description.head: Events
description.p: The mandatory elements within a "PREMIS:event" element are:

description.head: Agent
description.p: The mandatory elements within a "PREMIS:agent" element are:

description.head: Rights
description.p: The mandatory elements within a "PREMIS:rights" element are:

description.head: General
description.p: The METS file may contain zero or one fileSec sections. The fileSec section must contain, if it is present, exactly one "METS:fileGrp" element. The "METS:fileGrp" element may contain zero or more "METS:file" elements.

description.head: Files
description.p: Each "METS:file" element must contain an "ID"-attribute which must match the "METS:fptr[@FILEID]" attribute value in the corresponding object from the structMap.
Each "METS:file" element must necessarily contain a "METS:FLocat" element with the following mandatory non-empty attributes:

ul.li: "href" containing the file path relative to the SIP root directory in URL format.

description.head: General
description.p: The structMap contains exactly one "METS:div" element as the root node. Other "METS:div" elements are recursively nested within each other and describe the hierarchical structure of the SIP. Each "METS:div" element represents a file or folder.

description.head: Files and Folders
description.p: Each "METS:div" element has three mandatory attributes:

ul.li: "LABEL" containing the file or folder name
"TYPE" containing one of the static values "rootfolder", "folder", "rootfile" or "file"
"ADMID" must match the corresponding "METS:digiprovMD[@ID]" attribute in the amdSec section

description.p: There are four different types of "METS:div" elements, distinguished by their "TYPE" attribute. The topmost element can be one of "rootfolder" or "rootfile". All other elements nested below can be one of "folder" or "file".
Folder and rootfolder type "METS:div" elements contain zero or more "METS:div" elements, one for each file or folder within this folder in the file system.

File type "METS:div" elements contain exactly one more "METS:div" element with its "LABEL" attribute containing the static value "Content", its "TYPE" attribute containing the static value "content", and a "METS:fptr" element with its "FILEID" attribute value matching the corresponding "METS:file[@ID]" attribute in the fileSec section.

METS:mets.xsi:schemaLocation: http://www.loc.gov/METS/ http://www.loc.gov/standards/mets/mets.xsd urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9 http://www.loc.gov/ead/ead.xsd info:lc/xmlns/premis-v2 http://www.loc.gov/premis/premis.xsd http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink http://www.loc.gov/standards/mets/xlink.xsd

EAD:did.EAD:unittitle: Bericht und Antrag an den Staatsrat
